name: Chateau Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Well I am not sure where I need to start. I was very excited when I booked this place because it seemed like a great location and cute and cozy. NONE OF THE ABOVE! I rented the suite up at the top. It's the one when you go all the way up the stairs to the left. Don't get me wrong I understand these places are old but this was way too much.. When we got up to our room there was cobwebs all over. The smell inside smelled like burnt flesh if that is even a smell. I had to call them 3 times to come and see about the smell because it was THAT bad. They had to put "air" cleaners in the room. They had 3 hooked up. They said we could keep them the entire weekend if we wanted, because that is a relaxing vacation. The air didn't work, it was HOT AND STICKY. The bathroom was DISGUSTING. There was hair all over the counter and the towels were stained and nasty. Let me go to the bed. It STUNK so bad that I refused to lay in it. I was actually scared that the sheets were not even clean. LONG story short, I was planning on staying here for 3 days and after 5 hours there I checked out and went to the HILTON, where I had a clean room and NICE people. BTW, did I mention that when I explained to the lady that I wanted to check out because of all these reasons she REFUSED and said I was LYING. I still had to pay 300 dollars because she said now they wont have a chance of getting anyone in the room and I caused them to LOOSE money. NEVER AGAIN.
reviews.title: STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We wanted a cozy place to relax. At Chateau you get a more one on one then you do at the big hotels. Donna who brings you breakfast in the morning is the SWEETEST person we have ever met traveling. We had a great stay and we are already talking about going back in May.
reviews.title: THIS IS IT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I have traveled to NOLA many times and stayed at dozens of its hotels, but now that I have found The Chateau, it will be the hotel I return to again and again. The location is fabulous; in a quieter part of the Quarter but within walking distance of it all and close to Faubourg Marigny. A cinch to get in and out of by car and the free (AAA) parking was very appreciated. I felt well cared for by all of the staff, from the front desk to the valets and maids. Everyone was just plain nice and kind to me, even when I could tell they were having a hectic day. Breakfast was more than adequate. The muffins and danish fresh and warm; the coffee and juice delicious. Donna, who brought it to us every morning is a real sweetie. Our room was upstairs in the interior courtyard (overlooking a nice pool) and was quiet except for our neighbors who partied a tad bit hard one night. But, they were young and apologetic about it so we just smiled, remembering those days ourselves. Our room was very clean and well appointed with the "worn around the edges charm" of the Quarter. There is a refrigerator which came in handy and the beds were unbelievably comfortable. I would avoid the street rooms, though, as I would think them to be noisy. I just could not have been happier with my stay at The Chateau.
reviews.title: Eureka!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: This hotel is in the heart of the city; it's very well taken care for, the rooms are small but tidy and clean, breakfast was simple but lovely, surrounded by flowers, birds and happy people (in particular the very welcoming cook)
reviews.title: I found it by chance and I loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011
reviews.text: I suggest it for a short stay
reviews.title: Perfect! Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: As a person who travels to NOLA at least twice a year for 10 years, I've seen quite a few hotels. This is the WORST one I've been in. I understand hotels in the quarter can be outdated, old, in need of repair... I get it. Im used to it. Sometimes it is what adds charm to places. This place is not one of them. We booked a "double" room, the room was ultra small. There was only one key when we checked in, which made me wonder who had the other one and if the lock had been changed since it was lost... Front desk was very non chalant about it and did not really think it was a big deal and was rude. The sink backed up, there is no shelf in the bathroom to put anything. Carpeting old and smelled. The heat was on in the entire hotel. It was close to 80 degees in our room. We slept with the door open and the shower running with cold water, as did our neighbors. which I am sure made the rats we saw very happy. We were told there were no fans available and there was no way the heat would be shut off. There were no windows to open. Front desk did not really care or ask how our stay was when we checked out. Im sure they had many complaints. Pay the extra money and go somewhere else. DO NOT STAY HERE.
reviews.title: HORRIBLE.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Hotel is run by a couple of scam artists. Charged 4 times the normal rate during Mardigras week, and then had the audacity to charge another $25.00 for their garage parking (They dont have a garage, just a vacant area across from the hotel..Was told when I booked that parking was free, and then saw online that it was 15.00 per day, but then charged when I arrived at $25.00 per day due to a "special event"..Complaints did no good, the old man at the desk basically said pay it or dont park. breakfast was poor, cold, toast and coffee only...Stale bread is quite a treat 1st thing in the am!. The room was dirty, floors never vacummed during our stay, and had to ask for clean linens when we arrived as the bed still had used sheets on it--extreemely gross....Customer service is not here for sure..Take our advice and stay away from this one..Better rooms are avail up on Royal and canal streets..
reviews.title: Worst Ripoff ever. Stay away from this Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011
reviews.text: We booked a double room online 6 weeks in advance for 4 days around mardi gras and paid $175 a night. We accepted the premium rate due to the festival but had a number of disappointments. First of all the hotel charged us twice for our deposit requiring several emails and phone calls which were intermittently answered. When we arrived the room turned out to have no windows, only a front door with a glass panel on a dank corridor, and smelled overpoweringly of air freshener. We were unable to change rooms at any point during our stay. The hotel had not informed us that there might be the possibility of a room without windows. If we had known we would have booked elsewhere. Furthermore the plumbing was extremely noisy. Beware of room 110 and he rooms around it!
reviews.title: Overpriced with poor communication when they have you over a barrel at mardi gras

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a nice hotel right in the middle of the french quarter two blocks away from the cathedral, if you are lucky you can get one of the inside rooms, last time we went there we got a room outside next to the hotel and our door was in front of the street, so, you can hear whatever noise the street may have and if you are a light sleeper its not going to be a nice experience. The service is ok, they have their own parking lot ($15 fee) and some kind of valet so you don't have to worry about your ride. It has a nice little pool just in case the heat is too aggressive.
reviews.title: Nice hotel close to everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed Valentine's weekend; a surprise wedding anniversary present for my hubby. When doing my research I wanted old world charm, no bed bugs, great location & service, a late check out time (1 p.m.), great showers, free wifi and reasonably priced parking. The hotel met all of our expectations and more; the staff was very knowledgable and polite. The beds were super comfy and our suite was very charming and romantic. The previous blogger/poster is very much correct, t/ gal (Donna I think) who brought us breakfast was always super nice!!!!! On a different note, if you tend to sweat the small stuff, you may perceive the out-of-sight dust bunnies, wall cracks, and weathered paint as unacceptable, whereas we perceived them character flaws. However, t/ hotel is undergoing rennovations. The architecual design of the hotel and our suite was absolutely beautiful. We would definitely stay there again!!!!! We enjoyed our stay there more so than our five star hotel in Cabo San Lucus (honeymoon) .
reviews.title: Charming Hotel/Amazing Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very good place to stay if you want to be in the middle of the french quarter in New Orleans.
reviews.title: Good place to stay to be in French Quarters in New Orleans

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The price is reasonable if you consider that the parking is included. nice rooms, good beds, nice helpful staff, specialy the lady in charge of the breakfast, wich is served in your room.
reviews.title: Perfect location amidst the lovely french quarter

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only downturn is the internet connection, in our room it was very bad, this made us leave a day or two earlier than we would have stayed, if it had been working. It was not possible to use Skype and the connection was lost very freqvently. If you need to use the net to be connected - chose another hotel!!
reviews.title: Nice Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for about a week in March and enjoyed our stay. We were initially put in a room which opened onto the street and looked from the outside like a stable entrance; the inside was small but well-decorated. We asked to be shifted to an inside courtyard, which became available after 2 nights.
reviews.title: I absolutely loved my stay at the Chateau Hotel!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The courtyard room was very comfortable; noise is not an issue where this hotel is located. The rooms are immaculate, except a glaring exception which was the bathroom in the first room that had a stained bathtub and sink.
reviews.title: New Orleans charm in the heart of the Quarter.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I have stayed at many hotels in NOLA. This hotel is in a great location just down the street from Lafitte Blacksmith bar. We had 2 rooms and it was a great set-up...1 door entered into our 2 room area with a balcony and view of the pool. I would definately stay here again! The breakfast was a great start and if you didn't put out your slip they'll still get you something. The help was friendly and the building old NOLA charm. This is not the Hilton, this is something for those that like the local feel. I believe if you have AAA parking is free.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we gave the hotel every opportunity possible to make things right, but since we pre-paid for a room during jazzfest, we got the shaft.
reviews.title: FILTHY, BAD SERVICE -- AVOID AT ALL COSTS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: the hotel boasts 45 rooms that overlook the courtyard or the quarter, which is a LIE.
reviews.title: Quaint hotel with great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: we were put in a dungeon-like room with no windows next to the cleaning quarters.
reviews.title: Used To Be Better - Sort of Sucky Now

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: the sliding lock inside the door was broken. we ignored these two things, and it got progressively WORSE.
reviews.title: comfortable small hotel with many extras for the price

description: Guests of the Chateau Hotel can enjoy an afternoon relaxing by the pool, set amongst a beautifully landscaped courtyard with classic statuary and fountains. In the evening, the courtyard transforms into a romantic setting for guests to enjoy evening cocktails at the Patio Bar before a night out on the town. The Chateau Hotel is perfectly positioned just two blocks from famed attractions such as Jackson Square, Bourbon Street, the Old French Market and the Mississippi River.We invite you to stay at the Chateau Hotel where you will be treated like royalty in a timeless and intimate setting as a visitor to our exciting city.
